intro: Tripogandra elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested, a common trait among members of its family. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
